bugs.title: RFE: Add /var/lib/beanstalkd/binlog to list of rpm files

bugzilla.short_desc: RFE: Add /var/lib/beanstalkd/binlog to list of rpm files

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

Hi Jeremy,

I'm trying to write a selinux policy for beanstalkd. Fairly standard so far, but I'm hitting one issue:

The init script creates the /var/lib/beanstalkd/binlog directory, if it doesn't exists. But due to the way selinux works the initrc_t type doesn't have permission to create files in /var/lib.

Would it be possible to create /var/lib/beanstalkd/binlog in the %install section of the specfile, and to add it to %files?

Thanks in advance,

Ruben

Sure, that sounds reasonable.  It'll be a week or so before I can check that in. I'll be on vacation starting tomorrow.

-jeremy

No problem, I can wait for that.

Have a nice holiday!
Hi Jeremy, are you back yet?

Yes, thanks for the reminder.

Can you try out one of the rpms from http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=2004315 and see if that will work for you?

It doesn't look like I can make the /var/lib/beanstalkd/binlog dir owned by beanstalk user during the build of the rpm.  So I changed the BEANSTALKD_BINLOG_DIR default value to be /var/lib/beanstalkd.  Which is created at install time.

Ah, I see, the beanstalk user doesn't exist before %post.
I think I've done this before, have a look at the spec file of Pound for a way to solve this (http://cvs.fedoraproject.org/viewvc/rpms/Pound/devel/Pound.spec)

That did give me some ideas.  I'm have the rpm create the binlog dir in %post and put the directory in with a %ghost.  Try something from http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=2006467 and see selinux finds that amenable.

Hi Ruben, did one of those RPM's work alright selinux with regards to the /var/lib/beanstalkd/binlog dir ?

-jeremy

Oops, sorry for the late reaction.

Yes, this works fine with my draft policy.

bugs.title: Beanstalkd (prior v1.4.6): Improper sanitization of job body (job payload data)

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2010-2060 Beanstalkd (prior v1.4.6): Improper sanitization of job body (job payload data)

long_desc.thetext:
Graham Barr reported that beanstalkd v1.4.5 and earlier, improperly
sanitized job data, sent together with put command from client.
A remote attacker, providing a specially-crafted job data in request,
could use this flaw to bypass intended beanstalk client commands
dispatch mechanism, leading to unauthorized execution of beanstalk
client commands.

References:
  [1] http://kr.github.com/beanstalkd/2010/05/23/1.4.6-release-notes.html

Upstream changeset:
  [2] http://github.com/kr/beanstalkd/commit/2e8e8c6387ecdf5923dfc4d7718d18eba1b0873d

CVE Request:
  [3] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2010/06/02/4

This issue affects the versions of the beanstalkd package, 
as shipped with Fedora release of 11, 12, and 13.

This issue affects the version of the beanstalkd package,
as present within EPEL-5 repository.

Please fix.

I believe this should have been marked as closed, doing so.
